newsitem.title: MEXICO: Maseca says to invest $120 mln.
newsitem.headline: Maseca says to invest $120 mln.

text.p: Mexican corn-flour giant Grupo Industrial Maseca SA de CV said on Monday that it will invest $120 million this year to increase capacity and modernize its plants in Mexico and complete construction of two Central American plants.
"The investment plans of Gruma SA (Maseca's holding company) are for approximately $120 million," Maseca Director General Eduardo Livas told a news conference.

"This includes modernization and investments in increasing capacity in the Mexican plants and the modernization of those plants ... and completion of a plant in El Salvador and another in Nicaragua," Livas said.
Livas also said the company would increase capacity at its plants in the United States.
In addition, Livas said Maseca and Gruma would release first-quarter earnings results on Thursday or Friday.
The company previously had said it would announce earnings results on Monday.
